Comments_List: It was a good review of calculus
The most I can say I gained from the course was exposure to basic calculus and the ability to solve niche questions that were relevant for the exams.
I learned the uses of derivatives and some of the uses of integrals. There were also other concepts of calculus that were taught.
less going over proofs and more practice problems in class
I felt that the course was poorly structured to facilitate student learning: problem sets felt unnecessarily different from the material that would eventually be tested on exams.

The questions on problem sets helped us thoroughly learn the material. I thought the my class was too focused on theory and proofs and sometimes failed to actually teach us the material. Maybe in future years more examples of concepts could be done in class so that students have an idea of the material before completing problem sets.
I wouldn't recommend this course because it moves at a relatively fast pace, and it is often difficult to see how the problem sets help with studying for the midterm
No. I would not recommend this course to a friend who had never taken calculus before, and would only recommend it to someone who had exposure to the material if they were looking for a QR credit.
I would recommend this course to students that would like to major in something mathematics related or need this class as a requirement.
